abstract: Citi and RBS, based in Edinburgh, have at least held insiders accountable. Bank of America, by contrast, has done nothing of the sort.
snippet: Citi and RBS, based in Edinburgh, have at least held insiders accountable. Bank of America, by contrast, has done nothing of the sort.
lead_paragraph: What’s the difference between Citigroup, the Royal Bank of Scotland and Bank of America? Sadly, this is not the opening line of a Scottish-American joke  there’s nothing funny about the tens of billions in losses these three financial institutions have racked up among them, forcing them to go hat in hand to the state for aid.

headline.main: Bank of America Needs a Nudge

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and EDWARD HADAS

abstract: What’s the difference between Citigroup, the Royal Bank of Scotland and Bank of America?
lead_paragraph: What’s the difference between Citigroup, the Royal Bank of Scotland and Bank of America?

headline.main: Bank of America Needs a Nudge

abstract: Calls for the head of Kenneth Lewis, the chief of Bank of America, have been increasing recently, as the deal he engineered to buy Merrill Lynch has began to sour.
lead_paragraph: Calls for the head of Kenneth Lewis, the chief of Bank of America, have been increasing recently, as the deal he engineered to buy Merrill Lynch has began to sour.

headline.main: Let BofA Chief Get on With His Job

abstract: New York Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo may demand the return of $4 billion in bonuses paid by Merrill Lynch just before it was acquired by Bank of America, Bloomberg News reported, citing a person familiar with the matter.
lead_paragraph: New York Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo may demand the return of $4 billion in bonuses paid by Merrill Lynch just before it was acquired by Bank of America, Bloomberg News reported, citing a person familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Cuomo May Seek Return of Early Merrill Bonuses, Report Says
